Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 2280A - BIOCHEM & MOLEC BIOL
Description: An introduction to biochemistry with emphasis on protein structure and function, intermediary metabolism and nucleic acid structure and function.
Antirequisite(s): Biochemistry 2288A.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours. Note: It is strongly recommended that a course in organic chemistry be taken previously or concurrently (e.g. Chemistry 2213A/B or Chemistry 2273A).

Notes: PRIORITY TO MODULES IN BIOLOGY, ALL THE BASIC MEDICAL SCIENCES, CHEMISTRY, BIOCHEM & CHEM, HSP HEALTH SCI WITH BIOLOGY, BSC KIN, BIOINFORMATICS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Either Biology 1001A or Biology 1201A and either Biology 1002B or Biology 1202B; Chemistry 1301A/B and Chemistry 1302A/B. Integrated Science 1001X can be used as a prerequisite in place of Biology 1002B and Chemistry 1302A/B.
PRIORITY TO MODULES IN BIOLOGY, ALL THE BASIC MEDICAL SCIENCES, CHEMISTRY, BIOCHEM & CHEM, HSP HEALTH SCI WITH BIOLOGY, BSC KIN, BIOINFORMATICS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Either Biology 1001A or Biology 1201A and either Biology 1002B or Biology 1202B; Chemistry 1301A/B and Chemistry 1302A/B. Integrated Science 1001X can be used as a prerequisite in place of Biology 1002B and Chemistry 1302A/B.
PRIORITY TO MODULES IN BIOLOGY, ALL THE BASIC MEDICAL SCIENCES, CHEMISTRY, BIOCHEM & CHEM, HSP HEALTH SCI WITH BIOLOGY, BSC KIN, BIOINFORMATICS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Either Biology 1001A or Biology 1201A and either Biology 1002B or Biology 1202B; Chemistry 1301A/B and Chemistry 1302A/B. Integrated Science 1001X can be used as a prerequisite in place of Biology 1002B and Chemistry 1302A/B.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 2288A - BIOCHEM & MOLECULAR BIOLOGY
Description: An introduction to biochemistry with emphasis on protein structure and function, intermediary metabolism and nucleic acid structure and function.
Antirequisite(s): Biochemistry 2280A.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours. Note: It is strongly recommended that a course in organic chemistry be taken previously or concurrently (e.g. Chemistry 2213A/B or Chemistry 2273A).

Notes: RESTRICTED TO FOOD AND NUTRITION STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Chemistry 1301A/B and Chemistry 1302A/B; Biology 1290B; and registration in senior years of Foods and Nutrition modules.
RESTRICTED TO FOOD AND NUTRITION STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Chemistry 1301A/B and Chemistry 1302A/B; Biology 1290B; and registration in senior years of Foods and Nutrition modules.
RESTRICTED TO FOOD AND NUTRITION STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Chemistry 1301A/B and Chemistry 1302A/B; Biology 1290B; and registration in senior years of Foods and Nutrition modules.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 3380G - BIOCHEMISTRY LABORATORY
Description: This course consists of a series of laboratory exercises designed to familiarize the student with the basic methods in biochemistry and molecular biology, and to demonstrate concepts taught in biochemistry lecture courses. Students will learn how to present their results in an acceptable scientific format.
Extra Information: 3 laboratory hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biochemistry 3381A and Biochemistry 3382A.
WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biochemistry 3381A and Biochemistry 3382A.
ALSO HELD IN MSB 117. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 3381A - BIOLOGICAL MACROMOLECULES
Description: A consideration of the structure of proteins and nucleic acids; enzymology; elements of recombinant DNA technology and related methodology.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s):  A minimum mark of 65% in either Biochemistry 2280A or Biochemistry 2288A; a minimum mark of 60% in either Chemistry 2213A/B or Chemistry 2273A; and a minimum mark of 60% in either Chemistry 2223B or Chemistry 2283G.
WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 3382A - BIOCHEMICAL REGULATION
Description: Among the topics discussed will be principles of metabolic control, mechanisms of signal transduction, regulation of DNA replication, regulation of gene expression, and epigenetic mechanisms of gene regulation.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s):  A minimum mark of 65% in either Biochemistry 2280A or Biochemistry 2288A; a minimum mark of 60% in either Chemistry 2213A/B or Chemistry 2273A; and a minimum mark of 60% in either Chemistry 2223B or Chemistry 2283G.
PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s):  A minimum mark of 65% in either Biochemistry 2280A or Biochemistry 2288A; a minimum mark of 60% in either Chemistry 2213A/B or Chemistry 2273A; and a minimum mark of 60% in either Chemistry 2223B or Chemistry 2283G.
WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 3383F - INTRO TO BIOCHEMICAL RESEARCH
Description: Students carry out a research project under the direction of a faculty member, gaining practical experience in a biochemistry research laboratory.  Experimental design, critical thinking, and scientific communication will be emphasized, and students will develop skills at reading and reviewing primary scientific literature.
Extra Information: 5 laboratory hours per week. Enrollment in this course is limited.

Notes: 5 HOURS A WEEK, TO BE DETERMINED WITH SUPERVISOR. PERMISSION OF BIOCHEMISTRY DEPARTMENT REQUIRED.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Permission of the Department.
Pre-or Corequisite(s): Biochemistry 3381A and Biochemistry 3382A.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 3383G - INTRO TO BIOCHEMICAL RESEARCH
Description: Students carry out a research project under the direction of a faculty member, gaining practical experience in a biochemistry research laboratory.  Experimental design, critical thinking, and scientific communication will be emphasized, and students will develop skills at reading and reviewing primary scientific literature.
Extra Information: 5 laboratory hours per week. Enrollment in this course is limited.

Notes: 5 HOURS A WEEK, TO BE DETERMINED WITH SUPERVISOR. PERMISSION OF BIOCHEMISTRY DEPARTMENT REQUIRED.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Permission of the Department.
Pre-or Corequisite(s): Biochemistry 3381A and Biochemistry 3382A.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 3385B - HUMAN BIOCHEMISTRY
Description: A course dealing with biochemical and molecular aspects of the human condition. Topics in human disease, medical testing, and lifestyle are considered in a clinical-case-oriented fashion. The course focuses on various aspects of cancer and structural and metabolic disorders related to carbohydrates, lipids, vitamins, minerals, nucleic acids and proteins.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): A minimum mark of 65% in either Biochemistry 2280A or Biochemistry 2288A.
PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): A minimum mark of 65% in either Biochemistry 2280A or Biochemistry 2288A.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 3386B - CLINICAL BIOCHEMISTRY
Description: The application of biochemical and molecular principles to the analytical components used to select, evaluate and interpret tests for clinical diseases. Also included will be discussions on the specialized instruments required. Students will gain understanding of the practice of clinical biochemistry, as one of the disciplines of laboratory medicine.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours. Enrollment limited.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Either Biochemistry 2280A or Biochemistry 2288A with a mark of at least 65%.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 3390B - ADVANCED METHODS FOR BIOCHEM
Description: Students will explore the chemical and physical underpinnings of biochemical phenomena by solving practical, real-world, quantitative problems. Students will learn how to answer biochemical research questions by applying advanced experimental strategies and techniques, including methods in bioinformatics and the mining of biochemical databases.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biochemistry 3381A and Biochemistry 3382A.
WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 3392G - SYNTHETIC BIOLOGY
Description: An introduction to the principles of synthetic biology. Students learn to retrieve and apply information from databases to design and model regulated biological circuits using standard components (Biobricks). Teams of students create, communicate, and defend original synthetic biology proposals.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.
Note: it is recommended that Science 3377A/B be taken either prior to or concurrently with Biochemistry 3392F/G.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biochemistry 2280A, Biology 2290F/G, Biology 2382A/B and Biology 2581A/B.
PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biochemistry 2280A, Biology 2290F/G, Biology 2382A/B and Biology 2581A/B.
PRIORITY TO HSP SYNTHETIC BIOLOGY. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 4410A - MOLECULAR BIO DNA & RNA
Description: The use of fundamental techniques in molecular biology and molecular genetics are illustrated using examples from the classic and current literature. Selected topics include eukaryotic gene cloning, transgenic animals, rational drug design, DNA replication and cell cycle regulation.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biochemistry 3381A and Biochemistry 3382A.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 4415B - APPL SYNTHETIC BIO & CHEM GEN
Description: This course will explore how metabolic pathways are currently being re-engineered in microorganisms to produce drugs that are otherwise difficult to manufacture. We will also investigate how drug targets are being identified using newly developed chemical genetic screening methods. The impact of both approaches on medicine will be evaluated.
Antirequisite(s): Chemistry 4415B.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours per week, 1 hour bi-weekly tutorial session.
Cross-listed with Chemistry 4415B.

Notes: WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Either (Biochemistry 3381A and Biochemistry 3382A) or (Biochemistry 2280A and one of Chemistry 3393A/B or Chemistry 4493A/B).
WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 4420A - MOLECULAR BIO OF PROTEINS
Description: Topics to be considered at an advanced level will include: translation, folding and assembly, targeting, turnover, structure and motifs.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biochemistry 3381A.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 4425B - PROTEOMICS & PROTEIN BIOTECH
Description: The course will cover applied aspects of protein chemistry in biotechnology and protein design. Topics covered will include applications of modern analytical and biophysical techniques used in proteomics and related biochemical analyses, protein structure design, and antibody engineering.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours per week.

Notes: WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biochemistry 4420A.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 4450A - MOLECULAR GENETICS HUMAN CANCR
Description: Mutation of specific human genes subverts normal cellular physiology creating characteristic alterations called ‘hallmarks’ that fuel the development of cancer. The underlying processes that alter cellular pathways and gene function will be discussed. Cancer models and molecular therapies will be related to the cancer hallmarks.
Antirequisite(s): Pathology 4450A.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours
Cross-listed with Pathology 4450A.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. CROSS-LISTED WITH PATHOL 4450A. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biology 2581A/B; and either Biochemistry 3381A or Pathology 3500

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 4455G - TRANSLATION IN CANCER BIOLOGY
Description: The translation of cancer research discoveries into clinical practice, emphasizing critical thinking, research design, evaluation of data from the literature and ethics. Students will engage with community partners associated with cancer research, patient support and care, and will work on a team project relevant to the partners’ needs.
Extra Information: 3 lecture/tutorial hours per week.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biochemistry 4450A.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 4483E - RESEARCH PROJECT & SEMINAR
Description: The major laboratory course for the Honours Specialization in Biochemistry and Honours Specialization modules combined with Biochemistry. Lectures on laboratory safety, biosafety, use of animals in research, scientific integrity; an independent research project (topic and advisor chosen by consultation between student and faculty); scientific communication (two seminars and a written report).

Antirequisite(s): Anatomy and Cell Biology 4480E, Chemical Biology 4500E, Medical Biophysics 4970E, Medical Sciences 4900F/G/Z, Microbiology and Immunology 4970E, Pathology 4980E, the former Pathology and Toxicology 4980E, the former Biochemistry 4485E.
Extra Information: 15 hours per week. Enrolment in this course is limited.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 HONORS SPECIALIZATION MODULES OFFERED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF BIOCHEMISTRY

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biochemistry 3380G, Biochemistry 3381A and Biochemistry 3382A, with marks in each of at least 70%. Enrolment is limited, and is available only to students in Year 4 of Honours Specialization modules in Biochemistry, Biochemistry and Cell Biology, Biochemistry and Pathology of Human Disease, Biochemistry and Chemistry, Biochemistry of Infection and Immunity, Computational Biochemistry, and Medical Biophysics and Biochemistry. Students in the Honours Specialization in Biochemistry of Infection and Immunity may substitute one of Microbiology and Immunology 3610F, Microbiology and Immunology 3620G, with a minimum mark of 70% in lieu of Biochemistry 3380G as a prerequisite. Students in the Honours Specialization in Computational Biochemistry may substitute Biochemistry 3383F/G with a minimum mark of 70% in lieu of Biochemistry 3380G as a prerequisite.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 4486E - CANCER BIOL RESEARCH PROJECT
Description: The major laboratory course for the Honours Specialization in Biochemistry and Cancer Biology. Lectures on safety, use of animals in research, scientific integrity; an independent cancer-related research project (topic and advisor chosen by consultation between student and faculty); scientific communication (two seminars and a written report).

Antirequisite(s): Anatomy and Cell Biology 4480E, Biochemistry 4483E, Chemical Biology 4500E, Medical Biophysics 4970E, Medical Sciences 4900F/G/Z, Microbiology and Immunology 4970E, Pathology 4980E, the former Pathology and Toxicology 4980E.
Extra Information: 15 hours per week, indicate lecture/tutorial/lab hours.
To be offered for the first time in 2018/19.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 HONORS SPECIALIZATION IN BIOCHEMISTRY AND CANCER BIOLOGY.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): A mark of at least 70% in one of the following: Biochemistry 3380G, Microbiology and Immunology 3620G, Physiology and Pharmacology 3000E or the former Pharmacology 3580Z; and enrolment in Year 4 of the Honours Specialization in Biochemistry and Cancer Biology.

Courses.Name: BIOCHEM 4999E - ADVANCED RESEARCH IN BIOCHEM
Description: This laboratory course is intended for students interested in pursuing graduate-level research. Lectures on literature searches, data mining, and effective communication; an independent research project (topic and advisor chosen by consultation between student and faculty); scientific communication (introduction to topic, mid-year report, seminar).
Extra Information: 12 laboratory hours per week and participation in the Biochemistry Graduate Seminar.

Notes: PREREQ: BIOCHEM 4483E AND PERMISSION OF DEPARTMENT.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): One of Biochemistry 4483E, Biochemistry 4486E, or the former Biochemistry 4485E, and permission of the department.
